chapter.quote: The potential problem with the PM: Like all inhabitants of 10 Downing Street, he wants to take his place on the world stage. But people on stages are called actors. All they are required to do is look plausible, stay sober, and say the lines they are given in the right order. Those who try to make up their own lines generally do not last long.
The Foreign Office solution: The PM must realize that as far as Foreign Affairs are concerned his job is to confine himself to the hospitality and ceremonial role.
chapter.text: The way you fix that is by not making the call to Gtk.main() and instead just letting the program exit. Then just compile it with javac and you're on your way.
The real question is whether or not you know enough to run the program, or if you'd rather just "run away screaming" now...
